Pre-Game Insights: England are aiming to become the first manager to win their first three games without conceding a goal.Greece have a new managerial era with Ivan Jovanovic and have shown positive results in their first two matches.England have won 16 of their last 21 competitive home matches, drawing three and losing two.Greece have failed to score in seven of their previous nine meetings with England.The best striker for Greece, Fotis Ioannidis, is out due to injury.England have kept six clean sheets in their last nine games.The match is the first between the two countries in 18 years.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match is the first between the two countries in 18 years.England's starting lineup includes several young players and new additions.Greece's team features Premier League players Kostas Tsimikas, Konstantinos Mavropanos, and Odysseas Vlachodimos.The match is scheduled at Wembley Stadium in London.The match will be broadcast on ITV and STV in the UK.Best odds for England to win to nil are 1.29, for a 2-0 scoreline are 5.80, and for Greece to win are 13.00.
